description: ERECTION OF A MARQUEE TYPE STRUCTURE AT THE REAR OF THE PROPERTY
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Location Plan; Proposed Block Plan; Semi-Permeant Marquee: Front & Rear View; Semi-Permeant Marquee: Overhead View; Semi-Permeant Marquee: Side View; Manufactures Specifications - Rï¿½DER HTS (GZ) - Premium GZP-1000-300-463

Condition : 3 - This planning permission is for a limited period only until 6 May 2024, on or before which date, the marquee shall be removed and the land restored to its former condition. 
Reason - The marquee is permitted for a limited period only in order to assess its impact on the listed building and its setting along with the surrounding area, to accord with policy DMD2, DMD3 and DMD4 of the Sites and Policies Plan, policy CS14 of the Merton Core Strategy and policy 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan..

Condition : 4 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Protection of boundary wall -
The boundary wall shall be protected against disturbance or damage from the marquee. The marquee and its associated equipment shall not be fixed or supported to the boundary wall, or be positioned to be immediately abutting the boundary wall, or the boundary wall disturbed in any other way from the proposal. 
Reason - In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building and comply with policy DMD4 of the Sites and Policies Plan, policy CS14 of the Merton Core Strategy and policy 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan.
Condition : 6 - No music or other amplified sound generated on the premises shall be audible at the boundary of any adjacent residential building.
Condition : 7 - Any external lighting shall be positioned and angled to prevent any light spillage or glare beyond the site boundary.

Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:


   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
